page.title: 13SHOTESHAM/HOWE LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: There are two villages in the area. SHOTESHAM derives from the Saxon Scottsham, a settlement by a man called Scott or by Scots. Previously called Scotessa or Scotessam. HOWE derives from the Scandinavian hill or barrow. In the Domesday Book it was called "HOU". The city of Durban, South Africa was named after Benjamin D'Urban. He lived in Shotesham as a boy and as Commander _in_Chief of the Cape landed at Natal and left his name. Henry Howard, former Earl of Northampton, was born in Shotesham early in the 16th century. As a result his charitable trust endows a row of 8 cottages and a small hall,the Trinity Hospital, for the use of old people. The family of Anna Sewell, of Black Beauty fame, are buried at Howe. Roman remains have been found here.
